title: Iduna to crowdfund installation of 50 Greater Manchester EV chargers
lead: ​Electric vehicle (EV) charging firm Iduna is looking to raise £4 million through ethical crowdfunding platform Abundance.
author: Alice Grundy

title: Energising the UK’s net-zero future: How the West Midlands is storing opportunities for energy investment
lead: Energy storage could unlock the UK’s net-zero ambitions, but where do the opportunities for investment lie? Adam Titchen, industry lead at the West Midlands Growth Company outlines what the West Midlands has in store for the sector.
author: Adam Titchen

title: Power Factors acquires Greenbyte to create energy software company with global reach
lead: ​Renewable energy operations and asset performance management software company Power Factors has acquired renewable management platform Greenbyte AB.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: Honda teams up with Moixa as duo launch e:PROGRESS EV charging solution
lead: ​Moixa has collaborated with Honda for the launch of e:PROGRESS, an intelligent home electric vehicle (EV) charging offer using Moixa’s GridShare technology.
author: Alice Grundy

title: EVA England calls for government-mandated roaming as survey reveals charger shortcomings
lead: ​Roaming and standardised payments are still falling behind public expectations, with the Electric Vehicle Association (EVA) England calling on the government to mandate change.
author: Alice Grundy

title: Zero Carbon Business Partnership aims to aid SMEs move towards net zero
lead: ​A coalition of business, energy, industry and education bodies have come together to help drive SME progress towards net zero.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: Liberty Charge EV rollout completes first installation
lead: ​The first installation as part of the Liberty Charge project has been completed in the London borough of Waltham Forest.
author: Alice Grundy

title: Good Energy unveils EV tariff offering free periods of charging
lead: ​Good Energy is launching a new tariff that allows electric vehicle (EV) drivers to charge for free during periods of excess wind and solar generation.
author: Alice Grundy

title: Electricity North West pledges £2bn investment during RIIO-ED2
lead: ​Electricity North West (ENW) is planning to invest £1.97 billion during RIIO-ED2, a 44% increase on the current price control period.
author: Alice Grundy

title: UKPN begins ‘strategic, smart, specific’ tech rollout to enable more renewables
lead: ​Network operator UK Power Networks (UKPN) is rolling out new ‘load blinding relays’ to unlock capacity for new connections in a £1 million project.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: Octopus Energy to provide renewable energy to Ebico in new white-label partnership
lead: ​Octopus Energy has announced a white-label partnership with Ebico, providing renewable electricity for its customers.
author: Alice Grundy

title: Temasek and BlackRock announce $1bn decarbonisation fund
lead: ​Investment company Temasek has partnered with BlackRock to invest in next-generation net zero solutions, such as renewable energy technologies.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: UK ranks 5th in Wärtsilä’s COVID-19 Europe emissions scorecard
lead: ​The UK has come in 5th position in a ranking of the drop in emissions seen across Europe since the start of national COVID-19 lockdowns.
author: Alice Grundy

title: PODCAST: The role of long-duration energy storage for grids and solar’s global curtailment risk
lead: This month’s episode of the Solar Media Podcast, sponsored by Honeywell, is out now, featuring discussion on long-duration energy storage, grid stability and how solar is at risk of prolonged curtailment in Vietnam.
author: Current± Staff

title: Current± launches new webinar series with P375 discussion with Elexon
lead: ​Current± is pleased to launch a brand new series of webinars, focusing in on the key drivers of the energy transition in Britain.

title: EDF to sell its only UK CCGT plant West Burton B to EIG
lead: ​EDF has announced the sale of its only gas-fired Combined Cycle Gas Turbine (CCGT) power station in the UK, West Burton B.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: BECCS at Drax could save UK £4.5bn in meeting fifth carbon budget says report
lead: ​A new report produced by Baringa and commissioned by Drax has found bioenergy with carbon capture and storage (BECCS) could save the UK over £4.5 billion.
author: Alice Grundy

title: ScottishPower’s green hydrogen project looks to build UK’s largest electrolyser
lead: ​ScottishPower has submitted a planning application for the UK’s largest electrolyser as part of the Green Hydrogen for Scotland project.
author: Molly Lempriere

title: Current± Chats: Gore Street's Alex O'Cinneide on the 'critical components' of Dynamic Containment
lead: Current± ​caught up with Alex O'Cinneide, CEO of Gore Street Capital, to talk about the requirements of Dynamic Containment, the value in revenue stacking and the fund's international expansion plans.​
author: Alice Grundy

title: InstaVolt celebrates record-breaking month for charger installs
lead: ​InstaVolt has achieved a record month for electric vehicle (EV) charging installations, with 62 rapid chargers set live in March.
author: Alice Grundy
